meanings.definition: To desert a cause or party.
meanings.sent1: She was renegading from her old political party.
meanings.sent2: He is renegading from the group project at school.
meanings.sent3: The cat was renegading from its usual sleeping spot to the sunny window.
meanings.sent4: The autumn leaves renegading from the trees in a colorful rebellion.
meanings.sent5: The soldier renegading from his duty left his post unguarded.

meanings.sent1: The pirate captain was renegading against the rules of the sea.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys renegading against traditional fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was renegading by stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The artist renegading from conventional styles created a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The detective renegading from the law to catch the criminal.

meanings.sent1: The teenager was renegading by skipping school.
meanings.sent2: He was renegading by sneaking out past curfew.
meanings.sent3: The dog was renegading by digging up the garden.
meanings.sent4: The storm was renegading through the town, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The chef was renegading from the recipe, adding unexpected ingredients.
